descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course introduces undergraduate non-music majors to diverse musical cultures, soundscapes, and environments through an issue-oriented approach and a three-part listening model?sound, setting, and significance. Students will learn fundamental music concepts, develop listening skills, and engage critically with folk, popular, and classical traditions from Europe, the Americas, Asia, and the Middle East. Our discussions will examine musical diversity but also attend to the commonalities that cross regional and cultural boundaries and communities.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Requirements will include listening quizzes, written assignments, and attendance at a live musical performance. No prior musical background or training is required.

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Course textbook: Kay Kaufman Shelemay, Soundscapes: Exploring Music in a Changing World. (W.W. Norton, 3rd edition, 2015). ISBN: 978-0-393-91828-1
